verses.kjv: Hear this, all ye people; give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world:
verses.ct: Listen to this, all you nations; pay attention, everyone living on the earth:

verses.kjv: Both low and high, rich and poor, together.
verses.ct: Common and important alike, wealthy and poor together.

verses.kjv: My mouth shall speak of wisdom; and the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding.
verses.ct: What I say will be full of wisdom, and the thoughts of my heart will bring understanding.

verses.kjv: I will incline mine ear to a parable: I will open my dark saying upon the harp.
verses.ct: I will turn my ear to a proverb; I will reveal my riddle with the music of a harp.

verses.kjv: Wherefore should I fear in the days of evil, when the iniquity of my heels shall compass me about?
verses.ct: Why should I be afraid in times of trouble, when the sin of those who pursue me surrounds me?

verses.kjv: They that trust in their wealth, and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches;
verses.ct: There are those who rely on their wealth and brag about how much money they have,

verses.kjv: None of them can by any means redeem his brother, nor give to God a ransom for him:
verses.ct: but not one of them can ever buy back another person's life, or pay God the price for it.

verses.kjv: (For the redemption of their soul is precious, and it ceaseth for ever:)
verses.ct: (The cost of redeeming a soul is far too high — no payment could ever be enough.)

verses.kjv: That he should still live for ever, and not see corruption.
verses.ct: No one can pay enough to live forever and never face the decay of the grave.

verses.kjv: For he seeth that wise men die, likewise the fool and the brutish person perish, and leave their wealth to others.
verses.ct: Everyone can see that wise people die, and foolish and senseless people also perish, leaving their wealth behind for others.

verses.kjv: Their inward thought is, that their houses shall continue for ever, and their dwelling places to all generations; they call their lands after their own names.
verses.ct: Deep down they think their families will last forever and their homes will endure through every generation; they even name their lands after themselves.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless man being in honour abideth not: he is like the beasts that perish.
verses.ct: But no matter how honored people are, they don't last — they are just like animals that die.

verses.kjv: This their way is their folly: yet their posterity approve their sayings. Selah.
verses.ct: This is the path of those who are foolish, yet the next generation still follows their example. Selah.

verses.kjv: Like sheep they are laid in the grave; death shall feed on them; and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; and their beauty shall consume in the grave from their dwelling.
verses.ct: Like sheep they are destined for the grave; death will consume them. The righteous will triumph over them when morning comes, and their bodies will waste away in the grave, far from their fine homes.

verses.kjv: But God will redeem my soul from the power of the grave: for he shall receive me. Selah.
verses.ct: But God will rescue my soul from the grip of the grave, because he will take me to himself. Selah.

verses.kjv: Be not thou afraid when one is made rich, when the glory of his house is increased;
verses.ct: Don't be intimidated when someone becomes rich, when the splendor of their household grows.

verses.kjv: For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away: his glory shall not descend after him.
verses.ct: When they die, they won't take any of it with them; their splendor won't follow them into the ground.

verses.kjv: Though while he lived he blessed his soul: and men will praise thee, when thou doest well to thyself.
verses.ct: Even though they congratulated themselves while they were alive — and people will praise you when you treat yourself well —

verses.kjv: He shall go to the generation of his fathers; they shall never see light.
verses.ct: they will join the generation of their ancestors, who will never again see the light of day.

verses.kjv: Man that is in honour, and understandeth not, is like the beasts that perish.
verses.ct: A person who has honor but lacks understanding is no different from the animals that die.
